candidates.name: Sayeed Ahmed
candidates.why_stand: I believe Hastings has a lot of potential to improve in near future.

candidates.name: Bayden Barber
candidates.why_elect: I was born in Hastings and my heritage to the area goes back many generations. I have a wealth of experience in governance and am the chair of Health Hawke's Bay. I have enjoyed my first term on council and I work well with others to get the best outcome.
candidates.why_stand: I believe Hastings is the best place in the world to live. I want to ensure our people have good jobs and opportunities. Our want our key infrastructure operating as it should. I want our people in quality housing living in safe communities. I want Hastings to prosper!

candidates.name: Rebecca Burn
candidates.why_elect: I have been on committees and Boards of Trustees for many years and will work collaboratively to get the job done. I have a sensible, pragmatic approach to governance and look forward to continuing the growth that I see in Hastings.
candidates.why_stand: I believe we have to be the change we want to see in the world. I love living in Hastings and see it as an ideal place to raise a family. I am putting myself forward to ensure that it continues to be a safe place for my children.

candidates.name: Rion Roben
candidates.why_elect: As a member of two community committees and as a member of the board of trustees, I have proven experience in both governances and in accountability. I have experiences in management across a number of complex industries and I am currently studying a diploma in agribusiness.
candidates.why_stand: In our family, both I and my wife work full time and we know how hard it can be out there. Sitting around the council table I'll allow me to draw on these experiences and will help shape policy that will improve the lives of everyday mums and dads.

candidates.name: Geraldine Travers
candidates.why_elect: I am conscientious about ensuring I read all documentation, I think carefully about the issues and question where I am unsure. Through my previous working life I am comfortable talking to people right across society and they know that I will listen. I am guided by a strong moral compass.
candidates.why_stand: I like living in Hastings and through my working life I have gathered useful skills in governance and management. My whole life has been one of service and I want to continue to make a strong contribution to my community.

candidates.name: Eileen Lawson
candidates.why_elect: I have wealth of knowledge from my experience of working in a number of industries, including managing two successful businesses over the past 20 plus years. I have drive and passion as well as a good deal of common sense. I am positive and look for solutions and away forward.
candidates.why_stand: I am running for council as I want Hastings District to be a place where families can flourish. I know the issues that many families are facing, through my past voluntary work as Chairwoman and Counsellor at the Heretaunga Womens Centre. I'm dedicated to making our community a better place.

candidates.name: Wendy Schollum
candidates.why_elect: After developing my career in Auckland, I came home to run two successful businesses, marry and raise my family. As a business owner in the technology industry, my expertise is looking to the future, anticipating and adapting to change, and harnessing that change with practical, efficient governance.
candidates.why_stand: As a Councillor, I've worked hard to bring passion and fresh ideas to the district raised and educated me. But there is still much to do. As a mum, I want Hastings to be a place where our children will want to live, work and raise their families too.
